Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a healthy plant that has water and light.
The student can draw a plant that does not have water and show how it looks different from a healthy plant.
The student can label the parts of the plant in their drawings.
The student can show through their drawings and labels that plants need water to grow and stay healthy.
The student can use drawings to show the differences between plants with and without water.
